c74object.name: maxscore.bcanvas
c74object.digest: Render a MaxScore score in a patcher window
c74object.description:
maxscore.bcanvas
is a bpatcher-based canvas that receives a sequence of drawing messages from MaxScore in its left-most inlet. In addition, info messages sent to its second inlet are essential for more complex tasks such as non-standard microtonal accidentals. bcanvas supports the same messages as
maxscore.canvas
.

method.name: anything
method.description:
messages used by maxscore.canvas/maxscore.bcanvas to render
com.algomusic.max.MaxScore
drawing commands.

method.name: musicfont
method.description: Set music font. Supported fonts are Aloisen New, Jazz, Maestro and Opus.

method.name: textfont
method.description: Set font for the setText and measureText messages.

method.name: zoomfactor
method.description:
Uses native bpatcher zooming as opposed to the setZoom message to
com.algomusic.max.MaxScore
In comparison the picture looks more pixelated at higher resolutions but works well with any chosen factor .

method.name: offset
method.description: Offset the the rendered image by a certain amount

method.name: microMap
method.description:
A
microMap
is a plugin to maxscore.canvas and maxscore.bcanvas that allows user-defined microtonal notation. It consists of a Max patch which can be loaded dynamically and has a set of definitions as to how to interpret the
com.algomusic.max.MaxScore
PITCH attribute.
Example: microMap 0 mM-eighth-tones 1

method.name: writepict
method.description:
saves current
com.algomusic.max.MaxScore
page as a bitmap image.

method.name: svg
method.description:
svg
allows a page to be saved as vector graphics in
svg
format.
svg
is an XML-based language that can be processed by applications such as Adobe Illustrator or Inkscape.
svg
accepts three messages: write will save an
svg
file to harddrive (If the word write is followed by a symbol the contents are saved immediately in a file using the symbol as the filename) sets the title of the
svg
page and pagesize overwrites the canvas size communicated by
com.algomusic.max.MaxScore
Example: svg write /Users/hajdu/Desktop/untitled.svg

method.name: floatwindow
method.description: turn the canvas window into a floating window.

method.name: graphicsBuffer
method.description:
graphicsBuffer
offers another canvas-based method to add an extra graphics layer to MaxScore's rendered output. Valid messages are: add (add a new element to an unnamed graphics buffer followed by the drawing command) addToGroup (add a new element to a named graphics buffer followed by the name and the drawing command) clearGroup (clear a named graphics bffer) clearAll (clear all graphics buffers)
Example: graphicsBuffer addToGroup staff1 linesegment 0 0 50 50

example.caption: maxscore.bcanvas renders MaxScore drawing messages in a patcher window

entry.name: list
entry.description: Out left outlet: Mouse coordinates and modifier messages. Reconnect to the instance of MaxScore that feeds its messages to this canvas.
